metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15142 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
In DjVuLibre 3.5.27, DjVmDir.cpp in the DJVU reader component allowsattackers to cause a denial-of-service (application crash inGStringRep::strdup in libdjvu/GString.cpp caused by a heap-based bufferover-read) by crafting a DJVU file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15142` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

djview - 3.5.27.1-8ubuntu0.1
djview3 - 3.5.27.1-8ubuntu0.1
djvulibre-bin - 3.5.27.1-8ubuntu0.1
djvulibre-desktop - 3.5.27.1-8ubuntu0.1
djvuserve - 3.5.27.1-8ubuntu0.1
libdjvulibre-text - 3.5.27.1-8ubuntu0.1
libdjvulibre21 - 3.5.27.1-8ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: djvulibre package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.27.1-8ubuntu0.1').
